bugrepository.name: wordpress-mobile_WordPress-Android

buginformation.summary: Lists aren't formatted in Note comment view
buginformation.description: If a comment has a list in it, it won't appear correctly and will just be all clumped together on one line.

buginformation.summary: Reader Detail Page can be Blank
buginformation.description: If you are on a reader detail page, then press home and leave the app for a while, when you return to the app it will load a blank detail view.

buginformation.summary: Verify Infinite Scroll is Working Properly in Notifications
buginformation.description: Install the app fresh. Load notifications, make sure your account has more than 40 notifications. Scroll to the bottom, and observe that no more notifications are loaded.

buginformation.summary: Don't publish blank posts.
buginformation.description: Create a new post. Don't add any content or make any other changes. Tap the publish button. The app uploads the blank post, but then the upload fails with a notification that a title, content, or excerpt was missing. We should just check for the required content before uploading.

buginformation.summary: Menu changes scroll position when switching tabs.
buginformation.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Open the sliding menu. Scroll down to the bottom and tap Dashboard. Reopen the menu, you've been scrolled back to the top. Scroll back down to the bottom of the list. Close the menu. Open the menu again. This time the menu kept its scroll offset.

buginformation.summary: Cancelling post signature does not dismiss the keyboard.
buginformation.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to settings. Tap the Post Signature option to edit the text. Tap the cancel button. The modal dismisses but the keyboard remains.

buginformation.summary: Post list, hit the refresh button then try to select a post -> "An error occured"
buginformation.description: Steps: Start from the notification list Open the drawer and tap Posts Tap the refresh button Tap any post -> error popup shows

buginformation.summary: Post/Page list loses its place after refreshing.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the post list Pick an item midway down the list. Refresh the post list and wait for it to finish. The first item is now selected. Page list has the same behavior

buginformation.summary: Can't add image to media library from photos app
buginformation.description: If you add an image to the media library from the Photos app that hasn't been downloaded to the device, the upload fails.

buginformation.summary: Notification list, in airplane mode, the progress bar doesn't stop
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Login Select Posts in the drawer Switch to airplane mode Select Notifications in the drawer -> Progress bar never stops Note: Check other views too.

buginformation.summary: Images that aren't able to load show the WordPress logo placeholder
buginformation.description: The placeholder used for the note comment view is the WP logo. If the image is private or fails to load for any reason, the WP logo will just hang around. We should have a better placeholder image as well as handle the image load fail better.

buginformation.summary: Image caption appears in the editor after rotating.
buginformation.description: These are the steps I took, some may not be necessary: Create a new post In the editor add an image, then add another image. Tap the first image and make it featured and include in content, and give it a caption. Tap the second image and give it a caption. Rotate the device. The caption of the second image is now included in the post content.

buginformation.summary: Creating a new post category must start the progress bar
buginformation.description: Tap the "Create a new category" button Fill a category name Tap "Ok" (takes few seconds on slow network - without visual feedback for the user) Category is created and selected + a Toast is shown

buginformation.summary: Stop progress bar when the user changes blog
buginformation.description: Steps to repro: Go to posts and do a PTR Quickly open the drawer and change to another blog The progress bar is still going and you cannot do a PTR in the view. Even worst: if something bad happened during the PTR underlying network calls (say credentials errors) the loading bar is always running, you need to switch to comment to dismiss it. Also check pages and comments screens. Important: PTR on posts calls ApiHelper.RefreshBlogContentTask by passing the current blog as one parameter. RefreshBlogContentTask internally calls ApiHelper.refreshComments(mContext, commentParams); without passing the blog object (It relies on WordPress.getCurrentBlog()). So if you switch blog, the call to refreshComments will be done to the wrong URL (the url of the 2nd blog) with the credentials of the first blog.

buginformation.summary: Local drafts linker after publishing and the post list does not refresh.
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Create a new post. Make some edits and tap the back button. Choose Save when prompted to save the post as a local draft. Edit the post. Tap the publish button. The post will publish but will remain as a local draft, and the post list does not automatically refresh. Tap refresh. You are prompted that you are about to overwrite local changes. Choose OK. After refreshing the local draft is gone.

buginformation.summary: Timeout when uploading media
buginformation.description: Tested on self hosted, slow network, upload of the original image size (4000x2500), 1.5Mb jpg. Resulting in this error displayed to the user: "An error occurred while uploading media: null" Note: local draft is NOT deleted after failure.

buginformation.summary: Blog options not requested until returning to app
buginformation.description: While testing #1138 I noticed that blog.getWpVersion was always blank/null. This was because I had just added the blog to the app, and RefreshBlogContentTask hadn't been run for it yet. Looks like it is only run when you switch blogs, or return to the app. We could either run RefreshBlogContentTask after adding a blog to the app, or just get the options as an additional step in the Account setup process?

buginformation.summary: Rotate the device dismiss the keyboard while replying to a comment
buginformation.description: Tested on Nexus 7 and Nexus 5 Go to the comment list Tap a comment and start to write a reply Rotate portrait to landscape or landscape to portrait Keyboard is dismissed

buginformation.summary: Progress bar isn't visible on first Themes activity load
buginformation.description: Fresh install Go to Themes List is empty Theme list is loading in the background but the progress bar is not visible

buginformation.summary: PostUploadService refreshes the newly creeated post without taking in consideration the blogID
buginformation.description: PostUploadService calls the method WordPress.postUploaded by only passing the postID. WordPress.postUploaded internally calls the method OnPostUploaded of the current OnPostUploadedListener. Later in PostsListFragment->OnPostUploaded we use the postID and call getCurrentBlog to retrieve the post from the server and update the posts list. If the user switches blog while uploading, he/she will receive an error on the post list.

buginformation.summary: Gallery picker is blank if never visited media
buginformation.description: If you pick from the media gallery before visiting the gallery, it will be blank.

buginformation.summary: Images shared to a post from media library are too large
buginformation.description: Share a single image to a post from the media library. Observe that the image is too large and covers the majority of the editing area.

buginformation.summary: Reader crashes on xlarge device in landscape
buginformation.description: If you tap on a post, only on xlarge device in landscape, the app force closes. Has to do with the menu drawer icon not existing.

buginformation.summary: WPActionBarActivity calls onBlogChanged() after returning from settings
buginformation.description: When returning to WPActionBarActivity from settings, onActivityResult() always calls onBlogChanged() regardless of whether the blog has changed. This results in unnecessary work being done, most notably that stats data is updated.

buginformation.summary: Blog selector doesn't appear after changing from one blog showing
buginformation.description: Have one blog showing in the app. View the Reader Go to settings and show another blog Menu drawer will have no blog selector, as though only one blog is showing.

buginformation.summary: WordPress.com sites don't refresh automatically
buginformation.description: I fired up one of my Android devices that I don't use regularly. Since the last time I used the device, I've moved two sites over to WordPress.com. Those sites didn't show up in the site selector, even after poking around the app for a bit. When I went into Settings to see if the site was hidden, the list showed the new sites. Pop back to the main screen and the sidebar shows the new sites as well.

buginformation.description: @maxme I managed to get a log of that crash: FATAL EXCEPTION: IntentService[GCMIntentService-DynamicSenderIds-1] android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "=": syntax error (code 1): , while compiling: UPDATE notes SET id=?,timestamp=?,type=?,note_id=?,raw_note_data=?,placeholder=? buginformation.summary: unable to remove spam from comments listing
buginformation.description: using Wordpress for Android v2.8 on a Galaxy S4. Self-hosted Wordpress In my listing of comments on my site, there are some 20 spam comments, listed as "Pending". However, trying to remove them fails, and I will explain why. I had them listed in the app, but then went to the blog with my browser and removed them in Wordpress instead. Ever since, I cannot remove them from the app. When I try to either mark them spam or trash them, I get "an error occurred while moderating" and the comment is not removed from the listing. The log shows that there is an error 404 on the request.

buginformation.summary: Geotagging Inconsistencies
buginformation.description: Inconsistency in geotagging in Android: New Post > Geotagging option shows up Send to WordPress from Gallery > Geotagging option does not show up I do the second one most often and have to save the post as draft and re-edit before publishing to get the location added. Two other issues: Draft a post and set my current location, then leave. Return to post from another location and my original location automatically gets overridden. There鈥檚 no way to set a location other than the current one (but I think that may go against most use cases of the app so probably okay to not have)

buginformation.summary: Post Editor: Formatting blocks can be applied around images
buginformation.description: Create a new post Add some text in bold, leave the cursor at the end of the text. Add an image, then save the post as a local draft. Edit the post again, the image will be lost because the bold span wrapped around the entire image.

buginformation.summary: Rotating some views refresh data (network call)
buginformation.description: For instance in the show/hide blogs activity (we should review all refreshable views).

buginformation.summary: WordPress.com signin dialog style is weird
buginformation.description: That probably comes from a merge issue with the 2.3 removal branch:

buginformation.summary: Post editor shows html entities in localized post formats
Restore isActivityDestroyed() method in WPActionBarActivity
buginformation.description: 487d182 accidentally removed the isActivityDestroyed() method, which is an API 17 check.

buginformation.summary: After an account creation, user should be logged in
buginformation.description: Seems it's currently broken on 2.9-dev.

buginformation.summary: There is no way to change the post format after publishing
buginformation.description: Create a new post Set post format to "Audio" Publish Edit this post and change post format to "Standard" Re-Publish Post format is still "Audio" (local and server side)

buginformation.summary: Image disappears from editor
buginformation.description: Put device in landscape Add an image to the post editor Rotate to portrait Observe the image doesn't appear, but you can still tap on it and edit its settings.

buginformation.summary: XMLRPCClient are, at some places, instantiated directly without using the XMLRPCFactory
buginformation.description: Most network based test fails (because XMLRPCClientMock are not used)

buginformation.summary: Post Editor: Change save button text to 'Upload' when editing published posts
buginformation.description: If a user is editing an existing post on the site, and the status is publish, then the save button in the action bar should read 'Update'.

buginformation.summary: Gallery disappears after adding to uploaded post
buginformation.description: Edit an uploaded post Tap the image icon, select 'create gallery'. Save your gallery, you'll see the placeholder in the content area. Update the post, and observe that the gallery is lost.

buginformation.summary: Rotating the device when a comment is displayed add a new fragment to the stack
buginformation.description: Open a comment detail view from the comment list Rotate the device to change orientation Tap back -> you're not on the comment list Tap back again

buginformation.summary: Video not added to editor
buginformation.description: On a Galaxy S, 480x800 display I recorded a video in landscape and rotated back to portrait before returning to the app. There was a blank space there, just as reported in #1407. Perhaps the video thumbnail is generated somewhere else and also need to be scaled better to fit in either portrait or landscape?

buginformation.summary: Comment row stays highlighted
buginformation.description: Noticed that if you select a comment on a phone, then go back to the list the row will stay highlighted. It should only do this for a dual-pane tablet UI.

buginformation.summary: Crash when rotating with CAB showing in Media
buginformation.description: Load Media. Long-press on a media to show the CAB. Rotate, your app asplode.

buginformation.summary: Rotating from notifications detail takes you back to list view
buginformation.description: Open a notification to view its detail view. Rotate the device. Observe that you are back at the list view.

buginformation.summary: Swiping away a push notification should remove it from future notifications
buginformation.description: If you swipe to dismiss a notification, and then receive another notification, you'll see that it has grouped the two notifications together even though you've dismissed the first one. Question: Should dismissing a notification also mark that note as read, if possible?

buginformation.summary: Post List: Longpress + action does not update selected post in list.
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Long tap on a post in the list other than the one currently selected. Choose the edit action from the menu that appears. Tap back and dismiss the editor. Notice that the post detail shows the post that was the subject of the longpress but it is not selected in the list. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

buginformation.summary: Notification status icon disappears when device is rotated
buginformation.description: If a status icon for a notification is showing, it will disappear when the device is rotated.

buginformation.summary: AnalyticsTrackerMixpanel: potential bug, mMixpanel is initialized in beginSession
buginformation.description: Potential race condition: endSession could be called before beginSession and crash the app cause mMixpanel is null.

buginformation.summary: Edit Gallery: Tapping + icon shows a blank screen.
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Long press on the media list to invoke selection mode. Select multiple images and tap the Gallery button. On the edit gallery screen, tap the + icon. The screen that appear has a title bar with a done button and "0 selected" label, but there is no other content. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

buginformation.summary: Adding a blog to the app with "Contributor" role does show a wrong error message
buginformation.description: Adding a blog to the app, in which your user role is "Contributor", will show you a Username/password prompt just after the login. I think the refresh blog task doesn't get the 401 error well, and fire/broadcast a wrong event. In this case username or password wrong.

buginformation.summary: Themes: Loading spinners turn in opposite directions
buginformation.description: Maybe I'm being nit picky but it seems a little weird that the refresh spinner in the action bar and the large spinner in the themes feature would not spin in the same direction.

buginformation.summary: Themes: Rotating while activating breaks the ui
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Choose a theme from the themes list. On the detail screen, tap the activate button. Quickly change orientation. The activate button resets (the spinner is gone) The call to activate the theme will complete but the activate and preview buttons remain instead of showing the view site button.

buginformation.summary: Themes: Large spinner appears when refreshing and overlaps list items
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Go to the themes feature and let it load. Tap the refresh button in the action bar The large spinner reappears over the loaded themes in the list. This seems especially weird as I can still scroll the list while its refreshing. I'd expect either that the large spinner would not appear, or that I would not be able to scroll while it was visible.

buginformation.summary: Setting Featured Image for existing post not working
buginformation.description: Edit an existing post Add an image to the post Tap the image, and tick the box to set it as featured Observe that the image does not get set as the feature image.

buginformation.summary: Rotating comment view on tablet switches blogs
buginformation.description: Get out a large tablet like the nexus 10 that has multiple blogs Select 'Comments' form the navigation drawer Rotate the device Observe that the blog switches and the comments list is refreshed.

buginformation.summary: Refresh of Stats doesn't work if you switch app
buginformation.description: Refresh of the statistics does not correctly work if the app was open on the Stats screen and you switch back from another one. Steps to reproduce the issue: Open the app and go to the Stats screen Before the refresh ends switch to another app Go back to WordPress Refresh of stats doesn't work

buginformation.summary: Add a picture to an already published page is broken
buginformation.description: Open and edit an already published page. Tap on the content, and then tap on the media icon. Select library, and pick a picture from there. Upload the changes. The page is uploaded, with changes you may eventually done in post editor, but the new picture is missing, and just an empty IMG tag is in place.

buginformation.summary: Achievement icon too big in notification
Stats: Chart is empty when there is a low amount of traffic
buginformation.description: If you view the stats for a site with brand new or really low traffic, the chart data does not get rendered.

buginformation.summary: Empty line in the blog selector when sharing a text/picture to a blog with an empty name
buginformation.description: We should display the blog url instead of the empty string (like it's done in other places).

buginformation.summary: Stats: Data cleared after viewing 3rd pane of data
buginformation.description: In the first stats view, swipe to the 3rd pane and then back to the first. Notice that all of the stats data is gone from the first pane.

buginformation.summary: Reader post detail fails to show posts that aren't already downloaded
buginformation.description: When calling ReaderActivityLauncher.showReaderPostDetail() to show a single post in the Reader, the post never appears if it hasn't already been downloaded due to this. I've tagged this for 3.2 since it needs to be fixed in order for the notification redesign to work.

buginformation.summary: Reader doesn't load FP after upgrade
buginformation.description: FP remains empty after the reader db is upgraded - have to switch to another tag and then back again for anything to appear. https://cloudup.com/cIBIODzMYqT This was seen while using PR #1799.

buginformation.summary: The posts/pages list is not updated when you delete the last page/post of your blog
buginformation.description: Tried to deleted all the pages from my blog but the list is not correctly refreshed when the last page is removed from the blog. Pages list still has an entry for that page (that was correctly removed from the blog). Restarting the app fixes the issue. Tried to quickly fix it but found 2 strange behaviors in PostsListFragment: getRecentPostsTask returns success = false when the posts/pages list returned from the server is empty. It should return true, since the network connection is correctly completed. When false is returned the UI is not updated. If you delete all the pages from the app db, and return true (as it should be) in getRecentPostsTask, the method loadPosts is called. The latter calls refreshPosts, and goes in a loop...

buginformation.summary: Reader post detail header avatar is low res
buginformation.description: Assigning to myself, I have a patch ;)

buginformation.summary: Media/Pin Lock: Prompted with PIN lock when returning from photo capture
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Configure pin lock. Go to media. Tap the add button Choose capture photo. Take a photo or cancel. You are prompted by the pin lock. This seems a little weird. From the user's perspective the app has not been backgrounded (even though I'm in the camera activity) and its interrupting the task at hand. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Try to merge AuthenticatedWebViewActivity and DotComAuthenticatedWebViewActivity
buginformation.description: We should try to merge those two webviews in one. AuthenticatedWebViewActivity is used in a lot of places so we need to be extremely careful with testing. Keeping it for the next week when I will be on a big monitor :)

buginformation.summary: Media: Changing orientation while editing resets fields.
buginformation.description: Got to the Media list. In the detail pane, edit the caption or description Rotate the device to change orientation. Your changes are gone. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Media: Changing orientation while refreshing interrupts spinner
buginformation.description: Go to the media list and tap refresh. Rotate to change the orientation. The spinner has stopped but view is still refreshing. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Quick Vid: Error uploading. Invalid File Type
buginformation.description: Not sure if this is a server issue or app issue. When publishing a quick video the following error appears. "Error: An error occurred while uploading media: Could not write file wpid-VID_20131023_181817.3gp (Invalid file type)" Should the file type be .3gp? 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Media: Refreshing media list deletes locally saved media
buginformation.description: Start with a local draft post with embedded media. (Via quick vid with no wifi for instance.) Notice you can see the video thumb in the post detail. Switch to the media view. Notice the local vid has a local file path. Hit refresh. The local vid vanishes. (doH!) Go back to the post list. The thumb is now missing from the post detail. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: DashboardActivity.loadAuthenticatedUrl() doesn't encode username or password
buginformation.description: Discovered after noticing "View Admin" to go to the wrong page if the user's password contains spaces.

buginformation.summary: Publishing a post doesn't check network availability
buginformation.description: Turn off wifi. Take a quick video. Try to publish. The app tries to upload the video even though wifi is turned off. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Approve button still toggles when offline
buginformation.description: Ref: #1920 (comment) https://cloudup.com/cuPDMH9ruVB

buginformation.summary: Opening app from a push notification can show a blank/stuck screen
buginformation.description: Multiple users have reported that when they open the app from a push notification, the app will be blank and never load. 'WordPress' is displayed in the ActionBar with no other content displayed.

buginformation.summary: Notifications reply icon is incorrect
buginformation.description: Maybe the recent icon updates caused this. The icon should be the reply arrow.

buginformation.summary: Media: Tapping to select local media selects them all.
buginformation.description: Have a few different local videos in the media list. Tap one to select it. All local media items are selected. edit: local images are also affected

buginformation.summary: Can't change post format
buginformation.description: I changed the post format of a published post from "Standard" to "Status" and re-published it, but the next time I edited the post I noticed the format was still "Standard." Reproduced this several times, both with a published post and a draft post.

buginformation.summary: Update the stats icon before 3.4 release
buginformation.description: with https://wordpress.com/i/noticons/example.html#milestone

buginformation.summary: Media: Tapping refresh with no internet connection does nothing.
buginformation.description: Go to airplane mode. Go to the media screen and tap the refresh button. Nothing happens. Expected a prompt about no connectivity, similar to the one on the post list. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Post list: List can be empty after changing blogs with no internet connection.
buginformation.description: Edge case. Be in airplane mode and have multiple blogs in the app. Tap to change blogs to a blog you have not previously synced. Immediately you see the no connectivity prompt when the post list tried to refresh. (Maybe it would be better to fail silently in this case.) Dismiss the prompt and notice that the post list is completely empty, but the detail still shows the detail of the selected post of the previous blog. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Themes: Inconsistent no connectivity message.
buginformation.description: Maybe not a bug per se, but... Be in airplane mode and visit the themes tab. You'll see a toast informing you that the app "Failed to fetch themes". Seems like we should use dialogs or toasts consistently across the app.

buginformation.summary: Reader like count increments by two
buginformation.description: Video demo. Note this only happens in the list view. In the detail view it works as expected.

buginformation.summary: Post geo-location never changes from "Loading..."
buginformation.description: If geo-location is enabled, when I edit a post or create a new post the location never changes from "Loading..." until I tap the "Update" button. Also, it's not clear what "Loading..." is referring to. Would be better to replace that with an animated location icon (or, if nothing else, more descriptive text such as "Locating you...").

buginformation.summary: Share with WordPress style is broken
Themes need a loading indicator
buginformation.description: The first time you visit themes you're left staring at an empty screen. There should be a progress spinner or some other indicator letting you know that themes are being downloaded.

buginformation.summary: Media: Editing media in the app deletes it from the server on WP 3.4.2
buginformation.description: Go to the media list. Tap the add button and capture a photo. Once its uploaded, sign into the webadmin and confirm the image exists. In the detail screen, edit the caption and description. Click save, then refresh. The item you just captured vanishes from the list. Refresh the web admin and its gone from there as well. Seeing this on a blog hosted on appfog running 3.4.2, but can not reproduce on 3.6. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: 'WordPress' displayed as title in post preview
buginformation.description: Load a post like notification Tap the title at the top Observe 'WordPress' displayed in the title:

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Duplicate notifications when resuming.
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Be on the notifications screen and tap the back button to dismiss the app.(Doing this with the home button doesn't work) Tap to launch the app again. The notifications list has duplicated its items. You may need to scroll down to see the dups. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: getBestDateTimePattern is not available in API level lower than 18
buginformation.description: Replace that call for lower Android versions.

buginformation.summary: After deleting a local draft, you should be returned to the post list
buginformation.description: When I hit the trash icon on a post that's a local draft, after confirming that I want to delete the draft I should be returned to the post list since the draft no longer exists. Instead, I'm left looking at the draft I just deleted, and I can even hit the trash icon to delete it again.

buginformation.description: To reproduce: Be logged into .com and have a .com blog in the app. Add a new blog to the app. Use the self hosted path way and add a .com blog. View stats on the first .com blog added the normal way. Switch to the .com blog you added via the self-hosted path. Stats still show the first .com blog's stats even after refreshing.

buginformation.summary: Media: 404 images show as empty space in the list and detail.
buginformation.description: To reproduce. On a self hosted blog, add some media attachments to your blog. Login to the server and manually move / delete the image files. Go to the app and view the media feature. The media items with the missing images will show a placeholder in the list but if you tap the list it will disappear. The detail always shows empty space where the image should be. A 404 image might be nice. Maybe a bit of an edgecase but I'm thinking of blogs with missing media due to bad migrations or broken gallery plugins. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Media: Uploading media has not title on the detail screen
buginformation.description: Go to the Media screen and capture a new photo. While the photo is uploading, tap it to view the detail. The title is blank. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Push notification icon looks empty on lollipop
buginformation.description: The icon that appears when you have more than one PN looks empty on Lollipop due to the lighter background.

buginformation.summary: Media: Deleting an uploading media does not cancel the upload/delete it from the server
buginformation.description: Go to the media feature. Capture a new photo. While the photo is uploading, long tap and then delete the uploading item. Tap refresh. When the refresh finishes the deleted item is restored 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Weird status bar color on 10" tablet landscape
buginformation.description: Probably due to the transparent-status-bar-under-navigation-drawer patch

buginformation.summary: Media: Deleting an item does not update the counters.
buginformation.description: Go to the media feature. Notice the number of items currently in the list. Tap an item to view its detail. Tap to view the action bar menu and choose the delete option. You're back on the main list, the item is removed, but the count did not update. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Notification detail list flicker
buginformation.description: Start the app fresh. Load notifications, tap into a like or follow notification Observe for a few seconds, and you'll see a flicker as all of the list reloads.

buginformation.summary: Media: Tapping back from an item detail accessed via search does not take you back to search.
buginformation.description: On the media feature: Access the search feature via the actionbar menu. Enter a search term to view a subset of the media items. Tap on of the items to view its detail Tap the back button. Instead of viewing the search results you're back on the main list. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Themes: Blank screen when resuming from interrupted load.
buginformation.description: Fringe case probably. Go to the themes feature. While the list is refreshing, and no themes are currently displayed, background the app. Relaunch the app. You're on an empty themes page. In this case it might be nice to kick off a refresh to save the user a tap.

buginformation.summary: Users report the hamburger icon is not tapable
buginformation.description: Happens at least on a LG Optimus G and a Huawei Ascend G510

buginformation.summary: Themes: Refresh spinner can overlap detail actionbar menu.
buginformation.description: Go to the themes feature. Tap the refresh button to start refreshing the list. Tap a theme to view its detail while the refresh icon is spinning. On the detail page, notice the spinner is visible and it overlaps the actionbar extras menu. Bonus: Tap back to return to the themes list. Now you have two refresh spinners, overlapping each other, one of which is still rotating. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Autocorrect stopped working in comment reply field
buginformation.description: If you reply to a comment in Notifications or the Reader, you won't get any autocorrect suggestions above the keyboard. From a quick poke around in the code, it appears to be related to using a subclass of AutoCompleteTextView

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Fall back to using URL when loading blog preview
buginformation.description: Some wp.com users don't have a primary site, so the api won't provide a site id. We should fall back to using the Url if it was provided, and open it in the in-app browser.

buginformation.summary: QuickPost doesnt' like PIN Lock
buginformation.description: Enable the PIN lock feature, and try to use the QuickPicture/QuickVideo feature. When returning from the camera app the PIN Lock is shown on the screen. Even if you set the extended timeout on PIN Lock. This is because multiple activities are launched when the user hits the QuickPicture Item in the sidebar: Sidebar -> EditPostActivity -> Camera Activity. It's not a huge problem since QP is only used by a small % of users.

buginformation.summary: Stats: Pictures are shown as entry in "Posts and Pages" module but cannot be opened in Reader
buginformation.description: Pictures are shown as top-level entry in "Posts and Pages" module, but cannot be opened in the Reader when tapping on them. The Reader api returns a 404 error since they are not posts/pages. This should be probably fixed in the backend. A new field that identifies the kind of the item should do the trick. Once we see a picture, we will call the in-app web browser instead of Reader.

buginformation.summary: UploadMediaTask (and friends) doesn't return the error to the callback
buginformation.description: UploadMediaTask doesn't return the error string / code to the callback, and it's impossible to show something on the screen about the current error. "Upload failed" is not a descriptive error message. (Please check also the other Tasks)

buginformation.summary: StatsActivityTablet is a copy of StatsActivity
buginformation.description: Just noticed that there's a separate activity for stats on tablets. All of the Jetpack fixes will need to be applied to this activity as well. Or perhaps StatsActivityTablet can subclass StatsActivity.

buginformation.summary: Stats: 'Comments' label wraps
buginformation.description: On a tablet, the 'Comments' label wraps: https://cloudup.com/cc1RJMyFORZ

buginformation.summary: Stats: Bar chart glitches out while loading
buginformation.description: Watch the bar chart as stats is refreshing, it jerks back and forth a few times during the refresh process.

buginformation.summary: Ugly dialog text when deleting an untitled draft
buginformation.description: When you delete a draft that doesn't have a title, you get this dialog:

buginformation.summary: SwipeRefreshLayout is not displayed in freshly created activities
buginformation.description: When creating activities which use the SwipeToRefreshHelper, the SwipeRefreshLayout isn't displayed while loading. This appears to be a known issue with the v4 support library (since 21.0.0). It seems that the SwipeRefreshLayout is actually loading and working properly, but it's hidden behind the action bar. Some discussion and possible workarounds here.

buginformation.summary: WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying the wrong blog ID.
buginformation.description: While researching #181, I discovered that WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying by 'blogID' which is incorrect, it should be querying by the internal 'id'. If you add two self-hosted blogs with the same 'blogID' (it is usually '1') it will pull in posts for the wrong blog and cause problems very quickly.

buginformation.summary: Pictures are uploaded in a service that internally uses AsyncTask
buginformation.description: Was trying to upload a picture to the blog from the media library. Found out that if you tap on the picture to show the details when it is in "uploading" state, the MediaItemFragment doesn't show a preview of the picture (even if it's a local picture stored on the phone). This is because the ImageView that holds the pictures in MediaItemFragment is populated by an AsyncTask in background (correct, since bitmap decoding could take time), but at the same time another AsyncTask is uploading the picture in MediaUploadService, and there are no available threads to complete the rendering operation. When the uploading is completed the Rendering is finally done, since a thread is now available to run the task. AsyncThreads should be used for short operations only. Don't know if there is a simple way to increase the number of concurrent threads in AsyncTask. Same issue if you tap on another picture while the current picture is in "uploading". The preview of the 2nd picture is not shown on the screen even if it already uploaded on the blog, or available locally on the phone.

buginformation.summary: Update AboutActivity copyright year
buginformation.description: Should we do that automattically?

buginformation.summary: Refactor PostsListFragment
buginformation.description: PostsListFragment is doing a bunch of things incorrectly (I think it has remained largely unchanged since wpToGo in 2008...) Some ToDos: Remove the separate calls to load the local drafts and uploaded posts. A while back the local drafts were changed to be stored in the same table as uploaded posts, so we only need one query. Use a proper BaseAdapter/CursorAdapter for retrieving and displaying the posts data from the db. Proper m/v/c. Maybe use DateUtils.getRelativeTimeSpanString() for displaying the relative date to now? Add infinite scroll (see Notifications for an implementation of this) Make sure that these changes also fix #181.

buginformation.summary: Replace ACTION_MEDIA_MOUNTED broadcast that seems protected since Kitkat
buginformation.description: Permission Denial: not allowed to send broadcast android.intent.action.MEDIA_MOUNTED from pid=13367, uid=1024214 鈥� StackTrace: java.lang.SecurityException: Permission Denial: not allowed to send broadcast android.intent.action.MEDIA_MOUNTED from pid=13367, uid=10242

buginformation.summary: Double Posting
buginformation.description: I've found myself double posting via the app a number of times What I do: Create a post Add an image Hit publish Say to myself "hmm, I didn't get any confirmation, I wonder if that worked?" Open the post Hit publish again Facepalm

buginformation.summary: No action when tapping comment like notification
buginformation.description: Nothing happens when you tap a notification about someone liking a comment you made.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 3.7-rc-2: invalid rsd or xmlrpc URL starting with "//example.com" (no scheme)
buginformation.description: It happens rarely on site defining RSD link like See the HTML source of blog.chewyland.com for instance.

buginformation.summary: Categories list shows html entities and code for doublebyte characters
buginformation.description: On the new categories list, the category Pride & Prejudice is displayed Pride & Prejudice. Doublebyte characters, kanji for instance, are shown as character codes. For example, 銈儐銈淬儶 is カテゴリ

buginformation.summary: Post / Media : Adding image from media library needs to show loading status
buginformation.description: On a slow connection, it looks like nothing is happening on the media picker screen if the media library has not already been cached.

buginformation.summary: Post / Gallery: Confusing UI when creating a gallery while editing a post.
buginformation.description: Edit an existing post. Tap the camera icon and create a gallery You're taken to the Edit Gallery screen. The screen is blank and its not clear what i'm supposed to do. I'm not sure if tapping the + button is going to create the gallery or create a new post. Only after tapping it do I learn it lets me choose images to add to the gallery I'm making. Nexus 4.

buginformation.summary: Blogs with no title show in unexpected spot in show/hide blogs view
buginformation.description: Add a site to your account that has no title Go to Settings -> Show/hide WordPress.com blogs You'll find the site in the 'h' section of the list (I'm assuming because of the 'http' in the site URL)

buginformation.summary: Gallery : Crash creating gallery with some images.
buginformation.description: This is a weird one. I'm not quite sure what's happening but I can consistently reproduce on a nexus7 and a nexus4, both running 4.3 On image in the media list always renders where its thumb is either missing or blank. Image meta appears as expected. I can tap the image and view its detail, but the image itself doesn't render in the detail, and the detail does not have any layout for the image (no height reserved for it). If I try to add this image to a gallery the app crashes. "Unfortunately WordPress has stopped." The image in question: http://aerychtest.files.wordpress.com/2013/10/image_1382545119328.png

buginformation.description: For giggles, I removed the file extension from an image before uploading it to the media library. It instantly fails and tapping the 'retry' button instantly fails as well.

buginformation.summary: Incorrect label when sharing to media library from android gallery.
buginformation.description: Select an image on the device gallery and share it to WP. Tap the 'ADD TO...' spinner. Observe option says 'Media Gallery', it should say 'Media Library'

buginformation.summary: Logging out and creating a new account from the new NUX keeps posts from previous account visible
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Switching blogs doesn't clear comments
buginformation.description: I was viewing Eric's test blog in the app and clicked Comments in the drawer to show that blog's comments. I then switched to my test blog, which doesn't have any comments. Instead of clearing the list of comments, the comments from Eric's blog were still displayed.

buginformation.summary: Post editor shows html entities in categories.
buginformation.description: The categories section of the post editor will show code for html entities (but correctly displays double-byte characters). Example: Pride & Prejudice shows up as Pride & Prejudice

buginformation.summary: Media: Keyboard remains visible when tapping back button
buginformation.description: Its possible to dismiss the edit media screen, and even open the menu, without dismissing the keyboard. To reproduce: Open the menu and tap Media Tap an item to view its detail Tap to edit the item Tap into one of the textfields to invoke the keyboard. Tap the back button on the Action bar You've navigated back to the detail view but the keyboard is still visible. Bonus: Keep tapping back til you reach the root activity Tap to open the menu. The keyboard is still present.

buginformation.summary: Clean the "uploading" state for failed post uploads or app crash
buginformation.description: In some cases PostUploadService.onDestroy() is not called, and a post could be stuck in "uploading" state. It's tricky but we must find a way to clean this state in some cases on PostsList onCreate.

buginformation.summary: Posts shown for wrong blog
buginformation.description: After adding Danilo's 3.6 self-hosted test site to the app, I waited a few seconds for the app to retrieve that blog's posts but it was taking too long so I switched to one of my blogs from the drawer. The posts from the 3.6 site suddenly appeared - but they were showing under the wrong blog (since I switched blogs). I switched back to the 3.6 site and after waiting a while a dialog appeared stating "Sorry, posts could not be refreshed at this time." I switched back to my blog again, and it was still showing the posts from the 3.6 site. Restarting the app didn't resolve the problem - my blog continued to show the wrong posts until I deleted it from the app. I believe the problem lies in PostListFragment's getRecentPostsTask. It uses WordPress.currentBlog.getId() when saving retrieved posts, but the current blog id may have changed since the task was started so the posts get saved under the wrong blog.

buginformation.summary: Incorrect handling of audio files in media browser
buginformation.description: I have several MP3s in my media library, and they display incorrectly in the media browser. When I first visit the media browser there's just an empty white box for each MP3, but after scrolling that white box changes to a thumbnail of one the images in my library.

buginformation.summary: Refreshing posts after discarding changes still prompts you about unsaved changes.
buginformation.description: On the Nexus 7. Steps to reproduce: In the post detail panel, tap to edit a post. Make a change (or not) and hit the back button to return to the post list. Choose "Discard" when prompted to save your changes. Back on the post list, tap to refresh the list. You're prompted that you have local changes, even though you just discarded them.

buginformation.summary: VideoPress alert stopped working for WP.com blogs
buginformation.description: We used to show a message about VideoPress when a user attempted to add a video to a WP.com blog. Now it just errors out with an 'invalid file type' message.

buginformation.summary: Selecting images from self-hosted site does not add them to the editor
buginformation.description: I think this is the culprit. This is an issue with both selecting media and gallery creation.

buginformation.summary: Post preview stays after switching from a blog to an empty blog
buginformation.description: Select blog X Select a Post from the Post list and wait for the preview to load Switch to an empty blog Y (no Post at all) I see the previous selected post in preview, I should not see any preview

buginformation.summary: Tapping the image button in the editor returns the user back to the post list with a local draft
buginformation.description: Reported by several users on different devices: Nexus 5 - 5.0.1 Samsung Galaxy S5 - 5.0 ? - 4.4 I wasn't able to repro, potential steps: Create a new post Tap the image button in the toolbar

buginformation.summary: Some Notification settings aren't saving
buginformation.description: Go to Settings, and open the manage notifications screen change some value (for example disable Follows) go back to the main screen. wait few second and go again to the notifications screen Saving the global notification on/off flag appears to be working fine still.

buginformation.summary: Encode username and password in ThemePreviewFragment
buginformation.description: Same solution from #192 needs to be applied to ThemePreviewFragment.

buginformation.summary: Reader: Play button is off-center
buginformation.description: On my galaxy s4, the play button is not centered in the detail view of the reader. https://cloudup.com/cfiKCm2ub58

buginformation.summary: Refreshing the categories list forgets categories that were just checked.
buginformation.description: If I check a few new categories in the list, then refresh the list, the categories I just checked are forgotten.

buginformation.summary: "Load more posts" appears for empty blogs
buginformation.description: If a blog doesn't have any posts, the post list still shows "Load more posts" at the top. Tapping that changes it to a "Loading..." message which never goes away.

buginformation.summary: Adding new pictures to the Media Library is broken
buginformation.description: Go to the Media Library Tap the + button to add a new picture Either select "Capture" or "Select from local library" Nothing happens: the picture is not uploaded, no Toast error

buginformation.summary: geo location gets cleared on updating the post
buginformation.description: Self hosted blog Steps on the app (Android, Version 3.9.1) Steps to replicate on the App Create a post Geo tag the post Publish - Great, the post is geo tagged (verified on the site) Edit post - edit contents of the post Update/publish, the post geo tag gets cleared (verified on the site) Edit post again Update/publish, the post geo tag appears again (verified on the site) Let me know if you need any more information to replicate

buginformation.summary: Crash report 3.9.1: AssertionError in StatsCommentsFragment
buginformation.description: I've checked all reports, it an Android 4.2.2 bug only. Probably a platform bug. I tried to repro on a 4.2.2 emulator with en-gb or en-au selected but it didn't crashed. Also it's weird because the crash occurs on a Fragment.getString(STR, number) call only in StatsCommentsFragment, when it's also used other stats fragment (StatsFollowersFragment for example). It's rare (8 users affected), but I suspect it's super annoying (crash loop on app start). java.lang.AssertionError: couldn't initialize LocaleData for locale en-gb at libcore.icu.LocaleData.initLocaleData(LocaleData.java:167) at libcore.icu.LocaleData.get(LocaleData.java:121) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1039) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1009) at java.lang.String.format(String.java:1988) at android.content.res.Resources.getString(Resources.java:445) at android.app.Fragment.getString(Fragment.java:801) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsCommentsFragment.updateUI(StatsCommentsFragment.java:92) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsAbstractListFragment$3.onReceive(StatsAbstractListFragment.java:456) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.executePendingBroadcasts(LocalBroadcastManager.java:297) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.access$000(LocalBroadcastManager.java:46) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager$1.handleMessage(LocalBroadcastManager.java:116) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:107) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:194) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5422) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:837) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:604) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)

buginformation.summary: PostsActivity leaked
buginformation.description: While trying out LeakCanary I discovered a leak in PostsActivity. I believe the leak is caused by calling WordPress.setOnPostUploadedListener(this)in the list fragment here without ever removing that listener when the fragment is destroyed.

buginformation.summary: EditPostActivity leaked
buginformation.description: LeakCanary shows EditPostActivity is being leaked. This appears to be caused by HtmlToSpannedConverter using a static reference to the passed context here.

buginformation.summary: WPMainActivity leaked
buginformation.description: WPMainActivity is leaked due a static notification listener.

buginformation.summary: The parent category list under Add New Category is missing the step graphic
buginformation.description: Go to the categories list and tap to add a new category. Tap to open the parent category list. Child categories are indented but do not show the "step" graphic that is shown on the main categories list.

buginformation.summary: Back button doesn't quit the app
buginformation.description: Reproduced on 4.0 and 4.1. On a "root" activity (Reader or Notifications for instance) tap the back button, the current activity restarts. Expected behavior: the app is put in background and the home screen is shown. Problem comes from our WPLaunchActivity which is still in the activity backstack, so when a "root" activity finishes, WPLaunchActivity is created and re-launch the current "root" activity.

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Can't open external Urls
buginformation.description: You can't open links in notifications that aren't hosted on WordPress.com.

buginformation.summary: Reader: can't load 'Android' topic
buginformation.description: In the native reader, the 'Android' tag never loads for me.

buginformation.summary: A category containing a comma shows up as two categories on the edit screen.
buginformation.description: If I have the category "marco,polo", it shows up as a single category on the category list, but as two categories: "marco" and "polo" on the post editor. Fun fact: You can create categories that include a comma :)

buginformation.summary: Moderating a comment note doesn't remove the note until the undo bar disappears
buginformation.description: Tap a comment notification in the note list From the detail, trash or spam the comment The detail closes and you're returned to the note list, but the comment notification doesn't go away until the undo bar disappears I believe the problem is that the NoteVisibilityChanged event posted here isn't being received by the NotificationListFragment here because the fragment isn't active yet. @roundhill

buginformation.summary: Tag-like strings need to be filtered when creating a new category.
buginformation.description: Fringe case (probably) A user can type something that looks like a tag bar and the app will show it as such but WordPress actually filteres the and . The category is actually bar. It might be easiest if the app fetched the canonical category from the site vs trying to filter edge cases like this client side.

buginformation.summary: Can't connect to site that uses HTTPS redirect
buginformation.description: A user reported an issue with logging in to a site (http://www.androidpolice.com). The RSD response returned an HTTPS URL but the site would redirect all HTTPS request to HTTP. This confused the app and returned and ugly XML parser error in the app: This was fixable by instructing the user to enter the full path to xmlrpc.php, but the app can probably be smarter about catching this issue and then trying the URL again without using HTTPS.

buginformation.summary: Can't Choose to Trush Self Signed SSL
buginformation.description: I've had a few reports and have now tested on a couple of test sites. When you input your credentials it asks if you want to see details, and either accept or not accept the certificate. Details shows a blank screen and choosing Yes to accept just brings back the same message again. This is an example line from the app logs: SSLHandshakeException failed. Erroneous SSL certificate detected.

buginformation.summary: Don't show Java exception in NUX error dialog
Crash report 4.2 - NPE CommentDetailFragment

buginformation.summary: Blank categories are displayed in the category list but not on the edit screen.
buginformation.description: Edge case. It is possible to have a category that is whitespace, and that category can have child categories. The categories list displays these correctly, however the whitespace category is not displayed on the edit screen when checked.

buginformation.summary: WordPress.com login prompt shows after returning to StatsActivity with no Jetpack connection
buginformation.description: Add a self-hosted site that doesn't have Jetpack. Visit stats, then quickly leave the app. When you return to the stats view, you get the WordPress.com login prompt, as well as the Jetpack installation message.

buginformation.summary: Stats should clear out when switching blogs
buginformation.description: If you're viewing a blog's stats, then switch to another blog in the navigation drawer, the current stats stick around.

buginformation.summary: Remove html in stats resource strings
buginformation.description: The "stats: empty list strings" items in strings.xml contain html, which cause problems during translation.

buginformation.summary: Tapping a tab icon calls onTabReselected and makes the view scrolls to top
buginformation.description: Demo: https://cloudup.com/cXvvwrLe6KK Probably a bug in the support library v22: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=177189 - looks like it's fixed in v23.

buginformation.summary: Checked comments are kept after selecting and deleting comments
buginformation.description: Go to the Comments view Select 1 or more comments (via checkboxes) Delete them Comments are deleted but checkboxes are still checked develop branch

buginformation.summary: Jetpack stats aren't retrieved from db due to blogId mismatch
buginformation.description: If you view stats for a Jetpack blog, some of the queries to the stats db don't work because it queries on the blogid vs. the api_blogid.

buginformation.summary: Notification Settings: String update
buginformation.description: Change Updates from WordPress.com to Email from WordPress.com

buginformation.summary: Probable race condition with Notification due to deferredInit
buginformation.description: Since we introduced deferredInit, simperium is now initialized here. Notes bucket is null here and Notifications are not loaded. Apparently that only happens onResume, but since the app sometimes "starts" onResume, that's maybe not related.

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Open reader post from comment list
buginformation.description: You should be able to tap the post title to open the reader post when viewing from a comment notification. This used to work, probably a regression in 4.5 or 4.6.

buginformation.summary: QuickPress widget stopped working.
buginformation.description: If you create a quickpress shortcut, then tap on it you get an 'app not installed' toast message.

buginformation.summary: Formatting bar lingers after dismissing keyboard
buginformation.description: On the post editor, tap to edit content. Dismiss the keyboard. Notice that the formatting bar is not visible. Scroll down a little bit. Now the formatting bar is back. Tapping the buttons inserts markup where the cursor last appeared in the content view.

buginformation.summary: Verify that the user is still logged into WordPress.com on PN received
buginformation.description: Please verify that the user is still logged into WordPress.com when opening the app from a PN. Steps to repro: Log to WordPress.com Go offline, or in an area with no coverage Remove the WordPress.com account within the app Comment on a post of your blog Go online You will receive a PNs If you tap on the app the Notifications screen will open with no details, and an error message.

buginformation.summary: Deferred initialization causes problem with Mixpanel
buginformation.description: Loading account details is deferred, and may happen after we start tracking events. Deferred initialization introduced here b3bc0a0 What's happen in details: The commit above does move the loading of the user account on a separate thread. Meanwhile, before the initialization happens, the Analytics libraries could have already tracked some events when the app is in a state where the main .com account is still blank. Libraries tracks the user as a new anon user that is later (few events later in Tracks) aliased with the correct .com user On Tracks we should not have problems (*need to double check this with the team), but in Mixpanel we have problems since the user is tracked as 2 distinct users. Below is a picture that shows the UNIQUEs in Mixpanel for my account. (already logged in WP). A Tracks stack trace that shows what's happening: stdClass Object( [events] => Array ( [0] => Array ( [_ui] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ut] => anon [_ts] => 1442852632039 ) [1] => Array ( [_en] => _aliasUser [anonId] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632383 ) [2] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632489 ) [3] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632773 ) [4] => Array ( [last_visible_screen] => Notifications [_en] => wpandroid_application_closed [time_in_app] => 3 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852635782 ) )

buginformation.summary: Notification stacking issue on 4.5.1
buginformation.description: Sometimes (?) notifications staking doesn't work, and user gets a growing list of notifications. I can't repro, but @daniloercoli was affected by the bug too. From a Play Store comment: Notifications issue. With the latest update the notifications are not aggregated anymore. In a few minutes I had my status bar filled with a ton of notifications; annoying. I wonder if that could come from this patch f8d5108

buginformation.summary: Tough to select text
buginformation.description: On my galaxy s4, if I long press to select a word it selects the word, but when I lift off my finger the selection clears.

buginformation.summary: Reuse the same notification for post publishing / update
buginformation.description: Create and publish a post A notification "Post published" appears Update that post A second notification "Post published" appears, the first one should be reused Probable fix: use the blogid+postid as notification id ref. #3173

buginformation.summary: Can't view formatting toolbar with a hardware keyboard
buginformation.description: If you configure an emulator to use the hardware keyboard only, you'll never see the formatting toolbar because of the softKeyboardHook() method.

buginformation.summary: Native Reader: unliked posts stay in "Post I like"
buginformation.description: Like some post Go to the Reader (native), select "Post I like" category Unlike some posts Refresh -> unliked posts stay here (should not be there) We can also add this enhancement: When you unlike a post, it hides, and a pseudo-Toast appears saying "post unliked, undo ?". Clicking the undo button on Toast, makes the post appears and liked. See https://code.google.com/p/romannurik-code/source/browse/misc/undobar/src/com/example/android/undobar/UndoBarController.java for the pseudo-Toast

buginformation.summary: Crash: App crashes when rotating while signing out.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Be logged into wpcom. Tap the button to disconnect wpcom. Rotate the device while the spinner is visible. Boom.

buginformation.summary: Post can loose a category if its not in the category list when categories are added.
buginformation.description: Another edge case most likely. Add a new category to a post via the web admin. In the app, refresh the post list. Edit the post. Notice the category you added via the admin is included in the posts categories. Tap the + button to add a new category. Without refreshing the category list, tap the back button. Since the new category did not exist in the apps copy of the category list it was removed from the post. If you let the category list refresh before returning to the post editor the category will be retained.

buginformation.summary: Crash when sharing image from dropbox to media library.
buginformation.description: Open Dropbox, find an image. Choose the 'export' option and choose WordPress. Choose Media library. Boom1

buginformation.summary: Media Library: Image disappears from view shortly after upload - 4.6-rc-3
buginformation.description: When uploading a picture to the media library I see it show up in the view momentarily, and then it disappears. After leaving and going back in it shows up just fine. Here's a screencap recorded off of my emulator (on a self-compiled apk using the latest source from git) connected to a self-hosted site, although I saw the same problem on the latest beta on my OnePlus One connected to WordPress.com. https://cloudup.com/iyGvmEjotjP The difference is that the logfile on the emulator has an exception relating to the media library that isn't present on the real device. Although you'll see in the video that re-opening the Media Library was unresponsive for a moment, so the exception may be related to that. The full logfile can be found here: http://wp-srstancil.rhcloud.com/2015/10/09/wordpress-application-log/

buginformation.summary: Permissions check needed when sharing media to the WordPress app
buginformation.description: We've got permissions working when a user attempts to add media from within the app, but when sharing from other apps (Photos, for example) it fails without asking for permission. Reproduce: Android 6.0, disable media permissions Open Photos (or other app with media to share) Share a photo (or multiple) with WordPress, add to Media Library option Failure toast, no prompt to enable permissions

buginformation.summary: Reader auth fails when opening wpcom sites using the webview
buginformation.description: This is not working anymore, ReaderAuthActions.updateCookies was removed in #2360 Note: Sometimes it Works鈩� - that could be a side effect of an old cookie.

buginformation.summary: Swipe To Refresh can be triggered when a view it already refreshing
buginformation.description: Demo video: https://cloudup.com/c9HlwF1OeX5 Happens on the Reader and Posts list. Probably on other STR screens too. I wonder if that comes from a change in our SwipeToRefreshHelper

buginformation.summary: Creating a new category does not automatically add it
buginformation.description: If I create a new category from within the app it seems like it should be checked in the categories list by default. It shows up unchecked.

buginformation.summary: App acts weird if you're not an Editor or Admin on all of your blogs
buginformation.description: A user reported that the app is unresponsive and sometime lags or exposes unexpected behavior if hte user logged in isn't an Admin or Editor on all sites. also the login shows an odd behaviour: After entering my credentials at the login page the app shows a black screen for some moments then again requests the credentials, and again, and again, ... But if I cancel the login request I actually enter the app and my site/statistics/... Here's the log that shows some 403 and 401 errors: WordPress Android version: 4.6 Android device name: Samsung GT-I8160 01 - WordPress.onCreate02 - trackLastActivity, activityId: Me03 - App comes from background04 - ConnectionChangeReceiver.setEnabled true05 - Connection status changed, isConnected=true06 - Deferred Initialisation07 - Already registered for GCM08 - Configuring Simperium09 - Number of old stats deleted : 1110 - Response document received from the server: faultCode 403 faultString You are not allowed access to details about this site. 11 - NETWORK_XMLRPC - You are not allowed access to details about this site. [Code: 403] - exception: You are not allowed access to details about this site. [Code: 403] and later in the log 46 - Response document received from the server: faultCode 403 faultString You are not allowed access to details about this site.

buginformation.summary: When searching themes, rotating the device loses the search
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Open the theme picker Search for a theme Rotate your device Result: The top bar is still white (like the search bar) but it is empty and the theme picker now displays all of the theme instead of the search results After searching (searched for "twenty" and results are displaying): After rotating the device (top bar is blank and results are gone): Device: Nexus 9 OS: 6.0 App: 4.8-rc-1

buginformation.summary: Media browser new instance when sharing photos
buginformation.description: If the media browser is already showing, sharing to WPAndroid from the Photos app adds a new instance of the media browser instead of re-using the existing one.

buginformation.summary: Media browser blank images
buginformation.description: Quite often while using the media browser, images that I know have already been downloaded (cached) show up blank. This happens in multiple situations, but I can repro it consistently by opening the media browser, tapping an image to view the detail, then returning to the media browser. Demo video

buginformation.summary: Trashing Post From App Permenantly Deletes It
buginformation.description: Tested in both current production version and current beta version. When you trash a post from the app it is permanently deleted. It would make more sense if it were sent to the Trash instead so that you have the ability to restore before it is gone for good.

buginformation.summary: Site Settings: Updating site title isn't reflected in the rest of the app without reselecting the site
buginformation.description: If you update your site's title and then return to the main menu, you'll still see the old title at the top of the page until you either tap Switch Site and re-select it, or close and re-launch the app. Screencast: https://cloudup.com/c-6J8y6dzmM

buginformation.summary: My Profile: Rotating device loses unsaved changes
buginformation.description: While editing the fields in the My Profile section in /me, I rotated my device. This closed the window where I was making the changes without saving anything, so my changes were lost. That wouldn't be so terrible for the first/last name or display name, but I had added a big chunk of text to the "About Me" section and it was frustrating to lose it and have to start over. Ideally, I should be able to rotate the device and have the field I was editing stay open so I can continue editing it until I save or cancel the changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, beta 5.0-rc-1

buginformation.summary: Broken test: BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate()
buginformation.description: The BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate() test is broken as it doesn't take into account the condition of whether the blog is a WPCom one or not (only WPCom blogs can be marked private).

buginformation.summary: Sign In: Leaving the self-hosted login screen, it reverts back to WordPress.com login
buginformation.description: When first opening the app, if you go to the self-hosted login screen, leave the screen (either within the app or by exiting and reopening the app), and the return to the login screen, it will revert back to the WordPress.com login screen. Steps to reproduce: Open the app while logged out Select "Add self-hosted site" Optional: begin to enter your account information Tap on the Help icon (?) in the top right, or exit the app on your device Go back to the login screen Result: You see the WordPress.com login screen instead of the self-hosted login screen you were just on I encountered this in a very normal login flow, where I entered my username and site URL but had to leave the app to get my password. When I reopened the app, I saw the wrong login screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 5.0: NumberFormatException in SiteSettingsInterface.setLanguageCode
buginformation.description: Happens when selecting the last element of the list in Site Language Settings. java.lang.NumberFormatException: Invalid int: "null" at java.lang.Integer.invalidInt(Integer.java:138) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:358) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:334) at java.lang.Integer.valueOf(Integer.java:525) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.SiteSettingsInterface.setLanguageCode(SiteSettingsInterface.java:469) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.SiteSettingsFragment.onPreferenceChange(SiteSettingsFragment.java:372) at android.preference.Preference.callChangeListener(Preference.java:928) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.DetailListPreference.access$500(DetailListPreference.java:30) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.DetailListPreference$DetailListAdapter.changeSelection(DetailListPreference.java:279) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.DetailListPreference$DetailListAdapter.access$400(DetailListPreference.java:217) at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.DetailListPreference$DetailListAdapter$2.onClick(DetailListPreference.java:266)

buginformation.summary: Site Settings: should not allow user to make changes when offline
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to site settings while online Turn off internet connectivity See that you can change the site title and it gets saved in the UI, even though there's a toast indicating that the change was not saved: I expected not to be able to click on any of the settings while offline (and for the settings to be greyed out), and for the orange no connection indicator to be shown. If I do click on a setting that's usually enabled, I expect a toast indicating why I'm not able to use it (i.e. no internet connectivity).

buginformation.summary: Stats returns an error when the app language is non-English and the device is rotated
buginformation.description: When the app language (set in Account Settings) is set to a language other than English, rotating the device while viewing stats returns the error "Stats couldn't be loaded for the required blog." (I couldn't reproduce this issue with the app language set to English.) Stats error from the logs: 02-01 17:48:28.521 5608 5608 E WordPress-STATS: The blog with local_blog_id -1 cannot be loaded from the DB. Screenshot before rotating: After rotating: Tested and confirmed in Spanish, German, and Arabic on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.

buginformation.summary: Activity state is not retained when using manually set locale.
buginformation.description: Steps: Go to Account setting. Set language to something other than devices. Go to any activity (Comments list, for example) or just open a Reader tab. Scroll down. Rotate devices. Scroll position (and any other state activity had) is not retained.

buginformation.summary: User can't reply to comment notifications via Jetpack and HTTPS
buginformation.description: See: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/comment-replies-fail-on-https-sites?replies=5

buginformation.summary: Method checkForExistingBlog always return false when a blogName contains a double quote (")
buginformation.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/WordPressDB.java?source=c#L389

buginformation.summary: Themes: Prompt after choosing theme has misformatted text.
buginformation.description: Need a space after the name of the theme in the prompt text:

buginformation.summary: Themes: Newly activated theme is not immedately reflected in the list when searching
buginformation.description: To reproduce: Be signed into a wpcom account. Choose the Themes feature on the blog details screen. In the themes list, tap into the search field and search for "Twenty" to get a list of all the default Twenty... themes. Find the action bar at the bottom of a theme card and tap on the menu icon to open the menu. Choose "Activate". Notice that the action bar has not updated to indicate the theme is active. Rotate your device (Nexus 5x). Notice that the action bar has now updated. Interestingly the bar updates immediately when changed from the normal themes list (not in search mode).

buginformation.summary: Account Settings: Primary site selection persists when you select a different site
buginformation.description: Expected behavior I expect to open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and have the old primary site selection cleared. Actual behavior I open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and two sites (the old primary site and the new one) are now selected in the list. (However, selecting OK makes the correct change.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Me tab Select Account Settings Select Primary site Note that your current primary site is selected, and select a different site. Result: Both sites are now selected in the list of sites. If you tap on your current primary site first, and then select a different site, the radio buttons work as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-6

buginformation.summary: Visual Editor doesn't display unless symlink added if building on Windows
buginformation.description: From wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#374 If someone builds from Windows, they'll have to add the correct symlinks outlined here to get the visual editor to show up. buginformation.summary: Removed Jetpack blog reappears after signing in
buginformation.description: I can repro these steps on both an emulator and a real device (N6P): Go to the settings of a JP site and remove it from the app Disconnect from wp.com Login again The JP site now shows up again and is the default blog The problem appears to be due to this line in attemptToRestoreLastActiveBlog. That call to getFirstVisibleBlogId returns the ID of my JP site.

buginformation.summary: Can't login to self hosted site with http to https redirect
buginformation.description: Try to login with bia.is, app says "invalid url" - it's valid but the ?rsd url redirect to https://bia.is/xmlrpc.php We should fix this, users in that case have to enter the full url (in this example https://bia.is)

buginformation.summary: Stats: '1 views' displayed in Visitors and Views section
buginformation.description: On a blog where the views should be > 1,000, the app displays '1 views' in the Visitors and Views' section.

buginformation.summary: Show/Hide blogs list will restore selection after refresh completes
buginformation.description: Visit Show/hide blogs area. While list is refreshing, untick any of the checkboxes. After the refresh completes, your tick will reset to being checked.

buginformation.summary: Crash when returning to post editor activity after it was killed
buginformation.description: Edit a post Leave the app Kill the app process in adb Return to the app. Crash. Related to this, we need to find a way to save the post when the activity is killed so we can restore it when the activity comes back.
