buginformation.summary: Apostrophe displayed incorrectly when replying from a notification
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When replying to a comment notification, if you leave the same comment twice, a message pops up that should say "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you've already said that!" Actual behavior The message doesn't render the apostrophe correctly, and actually reads as "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you#8217;ve already said that! This only happens when replying from the notification. Replying from the Reader displays a more basic "Couldn't post your comment" popup. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and tap the notifications icon Scroll down to a comment notification, and open it Use the 'Reply to [Commenter Name] field to submit a comment Once the comment is submitted, try saying the same thing again to trigger the popup Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0

buginformation.summary: NUX: Funky activity indicator on gingerbread only
buginformation.description: Check it out: https://cloudup.com/cZd1q2pAOsB

buginformation.summary: Reader: post list does not refresh content when rotated
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Tap the refresh button on the reader post list in portrait orientation. Rotate the device to landscape orientation while data is still loading. Wait until the refresh icon stops spinning. - the list will not refresh here Rotate device back to portrait orientation. - the list will now reload with the new posts

buginformation.summary: Native Reader: Hyperlinks don't launch browser in reader comments
buginformation.description: http links work fine in Reader comments, but named hyperlinks don't seem to be tappable.

buginformation.summary: HTTP Auth Crash
buginformation.description: Beta user report: "When i try to use a self hosted site (password protected) with the new wordpress app, it crashed. I cant insert the http Username or password."

buginformation.summary: Kickstarter oEmbed URLs not embedding in posts published from the app
buginformation.description: Expected behavior I expected Kickstarter URLs starting with kickstarter.com/projects or kck.st to be embedded in a post, per the oEmbed list here: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-includes/class-oembed.php#L94 This works as expected when publishing from the web and viewing the post on the web. Actual behavior Kickstarter URLs are displayed as plain links in the published post (in the app and on the web) instead of being embedded. Steps to reproduce the behavior Find a Kickstarter project and copy the link to it (both the full URL and the short kck.st version) In the app, start a new post Paste the links to the Kickstarter project on their own lines in the editor Publish the post Result: The projects are not embedded in the post. Screenshots Kickstarter URLs posted from the web editor and viewed in a browser: The same Kickstarter URLs posted from the Android editor and viewed in a browser: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-19

buginformation.summary: Post Editor: Hard to tap on image and image settings don't update when editing a draft
buginformation.description: Some of the recent post editor changes have made it tough to tap on an image to view its settings. Also, it appears that editing a post, then editing an image's settings will not persist when saving the post again.

buginformation.summary: People: User role from Team shows up next to non-user viewer
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When a user is going through the Team, Followers, Email Followers, and Viewers, the correct user role (or lack of) should show up next to the username. Actual behavior Going from Team > Followers > Viewers in rapid succession results in the user role of someone in Team showing up as the user role next to the Viewer's username. ### Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Site dashboard > People. Add viewer to site. Start with Team selected, then select Followers (or Email Followers), then Viewers. Result: A user role of a user in Team will show up as the user role of the viewer, despite the viewer not having a user role. You must go from Team > Followers or Email Followers > Viewers to replicate the issue, going from Team > Viewers will result in seeing no user role next to the viewer, which is correct. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20

buginformation.summary: Reader post detail: Fast scrolling to top => the action bar stays hidden
buginformation.description: See this: https://cloudup.com/c7H5P784qA0

buginformation.summary: Notifications don鈥檛 always open on Android when tapping on a Push Notification
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When tapping on a WordPress push notification in the device notification center, the full notification content should open inside the app. Actual behavior I tap on the notification and the WordPress app opens on the notifications tab showing the full list of all my read notifications, but the one that I tapped on is not in the list, as if it doesn鈥檛 actually exist. (The toast "Could not open the notification" can appear for few secs). If I then wait for a while (anything from a few seconds to a minute or two), the unread notification will appear at the top. Sometimes I have to kill the app completely and reopen it to get the notification to be displayed in the list. Steps to reproduce the behavior This seems to happen mostly when I鈥檓 on a slower internet connection (mobile data with poor reception or unreliable wifi), so what I鈥檓 guessing is happening is that the push notification is received, but the synch with Simperium fails, or it's not started at all. Btw, sometimes it happened also when I was on fast connections. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Android 6.01 Tested on Nexus 5x Android 7.0

buginformation.summary: Initial Log In on Nexus 10 with Android API 16: Layout Issues
buginformation.description: The screen size or is it that we are landscape? https://cloudup.com/cGam9CimW86

buginformation.summary: Text Overlap in Post Editor
buginformation.description: Our app is plagued with this issue on JellyBean: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=38770 We need to set the EditPostActivity to not be hardware accelerated to fix it I think.

buginformation.summary: XXHDPI CAB drawable has a line through it
buginformation.description: I think i had this issue with Simplenote, had to adjust the colors in photoshop: https://cloudup.com/cPPkzYv4XA9

buginformation.summary: Hidden blog sometimes becomes visible again.
buginformation.description: Doesn't happen every time. Race condition maybe? From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss settings. Notice a different blog is now showing its post list. Confirm in the side bar that the blog is not visible. Go back to settings. The blog you removed is back in the list. Tap show / hide blogs. The previously removed blog is checked. Nexus 4. KitKat.

buginformation.summary: Notifications: comment reply text persists to new comments (field should be empty)
buginformation.description: Expected behavior After commenting on a post from Notifications, then opening up a new comment, the comment reply field should be empty. Actual behavior The previous comment I made persists in all comment fields, even other posts or blogs. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open Android app Click Notifications menu item Click on a comment on on of your posts Type a reply and click SEND action Comment is added Now, navigate to another comment, and see your reply text from step 4 is pre-filled in the form 鈥� instead of an empty form field Screenshots #### Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android version 7.0, WordPress Android app version alpha-25 Reference: https://make.wordpress.org/mobile/2016/10/27/call-for-testing-wordpress-for-android-6-1/

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Comment reply notification shows CDATA from XML
buginformation.description: Comment reply about a reblog shows some CDATA from the XML. Maybe specific to reblogs?

buginformation.summary: HTTP Auth dialog is shown when we should show a specific error message.
buginformation.description: In feature/fluxc-integration, when the xmlrpc endpoints return a 403 ( on listMethods), we show a HTTP Auth dialog to the user when we should show a "Access to your XMLRPC endpoint is forbidden, you should check your http server config or contact your host". We should also redirect the user to the right FAQ page on that screen.

buginformation.summary: Reader: Comments / Likes avatars should left align
buginformation.description: The left side of the like icons and the avatars on the comments list are off by a pixel or two. It would look a little cleaner to have them aligned.

buginformation.summary: Reader Detail: Rotating orientation scrolls detail to the top
buginformation.description: Title has it.

buginformation.summary: Magic Link: Logging in with magic link results in "Incorrect username or password" errors
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When I log in to a WordPress.com account, I expect everything to work the same no matter how I log in (username & password, email & password, email & magic link). Actual behavior When I log in with a username & password or email & password, the app works as expected. When I log in with my email and a magic link, some parts of the app do not work. Instead, I get the error "Incorrect username or password." This happens when I tap on: Blog Posts > View an individual post Pages > View an individual page Themes > any action (e.g. Customize, Details, Support) In the logs, I see this corresponding error: Username empty/null Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) to the login screen Enter your WordPress.com account email address Tap "Send link" to get the magic link Open your email and tap the button to log in Logged in, go to Blog Posts and tap "View" under a post Result: You get the error "Incorrect username or password." You can repeat this after logging in with a password and note that it works as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

buginformation.summary: Reader List: Content scrolls jumps after changing orientation.
buginformation.description: Scroll down the Reader list a bit. Take note of the visible story, then rotate the device to change orientation. The app tries to set the scroll offset so the user is looking at the same story, but the animation is distracting. Maybe make it instantaneous instead?

buginformation.summary: Reader: Wrong topic title shown after editing topics
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Switch to a topic. I choose "Coffee" Tap to edit topics. Switch from followed tags to popular tags Add "humor" Switch back to followed tags. Remove humor. Remove another topic (not the one you're viewing. I chose Movies) Add the topic back. Dismiss the topics form. Notice that the list refreshes. You see new stories for the topic (movies in my case) but the title will be the topic you were previously viewing. All steps might not be necessary to reproduce.

buginformation.summary: Reader Detail: Swiping on non-scrolling story still dismisses toolbars.
buginformation.description: Find an article that is too brief to scroll. Swipe up / down on the story. Notice the toolbars still show and hide but since we're not scrolling I'd expect them to stick around. nexus 4 / kitkat

buginformation.summary: Sharing: Confusion returning to the app after sharing.
buginformation.description: I started off in a reader detail. Tap the share icon and choose a destination app. I choose Simplenote. A link is shared to the target application. You see the application appear. Tap the home button. Tap the WordPress app icon to return to the app. The UI of the app you shared to appears. You can tap the back button instead of the home button to return to the WordPress app's UI but we shouldn't expect this flow from everyone. Nexus 4 / KitKat

buginformation.summary: Sidebar doesn't show newly added .com blog as an option.
buginformation.description: Start with one blog in the app. I was logged in with a wp.com account with four blogs, three of which were hidden. Go to settings. Tap to create a new wp.com blog. You're returned to the settings screen when you're done and you see the newly added blog in the list. Dismiss the settings screen. Check the sidebar. Notice the blog picker is absent and you can't switch to your newly added blog. Nexus 4 / KitKat

buginformation.summary: Reader: Posts I Like shows unliked posts.
buginformation.description: Go to the reader and set the topic to Posts I Like. Unlike a post. Refresh the list. The post is still there in its unliked state.

buginformation.summary: Editor: Link dialog "Next" button on keyboard or form doesn't do anything.
buginformation.description: I have a vague memory of this issue being opened before but I couldn't find the ticket after a quick search. In the editor, tap the link option on the format bar. In the link dialog, tap the next button on the keyboard. The cursor should move to the next text field but it remains in the first text field. Rotate the app to landscape orientation. The dialog shows a full screen text field with a next button added to the UI. Tap this button. Nothing happens. Nexus 4 / KitKat.

buginformation.summary: FluxC integration: Site picker sometimes doesn't work
buginformation.description: I'm sometimes unable to switch sites using the site picker in the fluxc-integration branch. There is no error, but I'm returned to the site fragment with the same site active as before. The only way to change sites is to remove the current site (or sign out of WP.com). I've so far only been able to reproduce this on an emulator (API 23). This will happen every time I use the site picker until the app is reinstalled (and most recently, the issue persists even after multiple clean installs). After some testing, I'm seeing that getSiteFragment() is returning null here, so the result of the SitePickerActivity seems to be discarded, and that's the reason the site doesn't changed.

buginformation.summary: Editor: Editor scrolls to bottom after inserting media
buginformation.description: Edit a post. Make sure it has enough content to scroll. Insert the cursor near the top of the screen. Tap the photo option on the format bar to insert an image at the cursor position. I chose to insert an image from the gallery. Pick an image to return to the editor. Notice that the textfield has scrolled to the bottom of the screen, but the image has been inserted in the correct location. We want to avoid scrolling away from where the image was inserted.

buginformation.summary: Posts: Long press on draft includes comment and share options.
buginformation.description: In the post list, long press on a draft post. In the intents dialog, you'll see options for sharing and commenting. These seem out of place. If you choose sharing, you'll be met with a connection error. If you choose comment, you'll be able to leave a comment on the draft. How weird is that?

buginformation.summary: Editor: Unable to add imags to an edited post.
buginformation.description: From the post list, create a new post. Go into options and change the status to draft. Return to the editor, add a title and some text and save. Tap on the newly created draft in the post list and edit it. Position the cursor and try to add an image from a gallery. You'll see the image added in the editor. Tap save. Tap to view the draft post. The image is not there, neither is there any HTML for it. Try again, but this time take a photo instead of choosing an image from your gallery. After taking the photo you're returned to the editor. Notice that everything above the photo thumbnail is missing. Tap save. Tap to view the draft. None of the changes you observed are there.

buginformation.summary: Editor: Comment view changes form when changing orientation.
buginformation.description: Start in landscape orientation. From a post detail, tap the comment icon to view the Write Comment dialog. Rotate to portrait orientation. Rotate back to landscape. The form is replaced by a full screen text field. Nexus 4 / KitKat

buginformation.summary: Editor: When there is no media, don't show a blank Select From Media Library view.

Let's inform the user that there is no media, or prompt them to choose from another source. Even better, can we not show this option in the initial dialog.

buginformation.summary: Themes missing from sidebar after switching blogs.
buginformation.description: Open the side bar. Notice that the themes option is present. Switch to a different blog. Bye bye themes option. It eventually comes back after some usage. Nexus 4 / KitKat

buginformation.summary: Post List: Untitled draft left after discarding a new post.
buginformation.description: From the post list, start a new post. Give the new post a title, and some content for kicks. Tap the back button. When prompted, choose to discard the new post. When the post list refreshes you'll see an Untitled draft post in the list.

buginformation.summary: Media: Broken images after canceling a post. Also Crash
buginformation.description: This is easiest to see if you create a new wp.com blog with no posts or media. Go to the post editor and create a new post. Add some media via the post editor. You should see the thumbnails in the editor. Tap the back button and discard the post. Switch to the Media option in the menu. Notice there is an item in the media list but the thumbnail is blank. Tap to view the detail and the photo there is also blank. Bonus: Try to delete the media item and the app crashes.

buginformation.summary: Notifications - DB/Cache is not cleated on logout
buginformation.description: I did the logout, and just after I logged in again with a different wpcom user. The app took me on the Notifications list screen, and all the old notifications were there till the initial refresh was completed.

Open drawer, select another blog without media List is empty but the "Displaying media from ... to ..." message is still here We should remove that message if there is no media and display an empty view.

buginformation.summary: Blog.save() called ~100 times when switching from Stats to Post list
buginformation.description: When I switch from "Stats" to "Post" and back, I noticing some slow down on my Nexus 5 After some profiling, I noticed Blog.save() was called ~2 times / sec for for a total of ~100 times (the tested account owns only 3 blogs), blogs haven't been changed so we should not call save(). Also we should check queued RefreshBlogContentTask tasks and remove duplicate calls.

buginformation.summary: Select first row of notifications after refresh on tablet
buginformation.description: After notifications loads for the first time, and user is on a tablet, the first row should be selected so that the detail view is loaded with content.

buginformation.summary: App can have wrong blog active after hiding blogs
buginformation.description: Add an account with multiple blogs. Take note of which blog is currently active. Hide all blogs except for a blog that is different than the currently active one. Return from settings, and you will be stuck using the first active blog.

buginformation.summary: Media: Sharing a video to a WP.com post doesn't use VideoPress shortcode
buginformation.description: Go to Media library, and share a video to a new post. The icon shows the image placeholder? Publish post. Video shortcode is not used and all I get is 'click to view video' on my WP.com test blog.

buginformation.summary: Incorrect Usages of blog.getId() and blog.getBlogId()?
buginformation.description: I think some poor naming has caused some problems in the app. In the Blog model we have getId() and getBlogId(). The 'id' is the local id of the blog, corresponds to the unique key in the local SQLite blog table. The 'blogId' is the remote blog ID, which is typically just '1' for WordPress.org blogs, and on Multi-site and WordPress.com it is a unique integer that identifies the individual blog across the site instance. The problem I'm seeing is that we are often using getBlogId() as the key for other objects, such as in Media. If a user has multiple self-hosted blogs with a blogId of '1' then they are going to see media items for both blogs when they visit media. I think we need to rename these to be clearer, and do an audit of the app and fix instances where we should use the id instead of the blogId.

buginformation.summary: Unusable slider for image size in the editor
buginformation.description: as mentionned here 鈥媓ttp://androiddevel.wordpress.com/2012/01/23/heres-whats-on-the-list-for-2-0-5/#comment-7908 As the default image size currently doesn't work (it always uploads pictures 脿 500px), we have to change the size of the uploaded media in the text editor, by taping on the picture. There's a slider for that purpose. The slider is not really precise if you're not a kid with tiny fingers. A spinner or even a text field would be really better. Even if i have a big screen (4.3"), it takes at least 30 seconds before i can make my picture 960px wide (it always fall on 940px, or 970px when i remove my finger), whereas it would take like 2 seconds with a spinner or a text field.

buginformation.summary: Funky chars around comment reply
buginformation.description: This is on a Nexus 7 on 4.1: http://cl.ly/image/3K0X051Y2L18

buginformation.summary: Trapped on the configure blog screen.
buginformation.description: When adding a self hosted blog on a spotty wifi connection you can get trapped on the "Attempting to configure blog" screen for a long period of time. It might make sense to make this dismissable and let the user reattempt to add the blog with a better connection, or another time, than be stuck waiting for the call to timeout/finish.

buginformation.summary: Featured images on pages are broken.
buginformation.description: Edit a page Add an image. Tap the image and check the option to use it as a featured image. Do not check the option to include the image in the content. Publish the page. An image tag for the featured image is included in the post body even though you did not check the option to do this. The image tag is missing a src attribute, and has android-uri="content:// ... " instead.

buginformation.summary: NUX: Device rotation returns to .com login
buginformation.description: If the device is rotated while adding a self-hosted site, it returns to the .com login layout.

buginformation.summary: Login screen / create account - make everything fit in landscape for 480x800 screens
buginformation.description: https://cloudup.com/cLWgnQo4LPY

buginformation.summary: Posts: Change title of post and update the ViewPostFragment of the opened Post
buginformation.description: When you edit the title of the post and Publish/Save the post, it will load the ViewPostFragment with older details. The ViewPostFragment will only update when you open the post again from the listview

buginformation.summary: Some users are losing posts when attempting upload
buginformation.description: I've had support threads with two users so far that can't upload posts in 2.6. They can uninstall the app and it will work for a while, but then posts won't upload and error with the blog_not_found error, which I believe happens here: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/util/PostUploadService.java#L207 One user gave me an author account on the site and I can't reproduce so far. Both users are attempting to upload images, so I'm wondering if #730 might have helped with this. I'm going to send the 2.6.1 beta to them to see if it fixes the issue.

buginformation.summary: Duplicate Notification Types and Blogs in PreferencesActivity
buginformation.description: When you load up PreferencesActivity, you'll see duplicate notification type settings, as well as duplicated list of blogs in the notifications settings.

buginformation.summary: Scroll position appears to be lost when rotating.
buginformation.description: On the nexus 7 in portrait orientation Go to the post list. Scroll all the way down and load more posts. Rotate to landscape orientation. The posts list is scrolled up a bit making it look like you lost your place. Maybe there is a way to keep the list fully scrolled when rotating?

buginformation.summary: Stats: rotation loses selection
buginformation.description: Select "Weeks" under "Visitors and Views," then rotate the device. It'll return to "Days."

buginformation.summary: Media: crash when deleting items
buginformation.description: Activate the CAB mode in Media, select one or more items, then hit the trash icon. Exception below occurs for me every time. android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: String resource ID #0x7f0d0245 at android.content.res.Resources.getText(Resources.java:244) at android.content.Context.getText(Context.java:333) at android.app.AlertDialog$Builder.setPositiveButton(AlertDialog.java:488) at org.wordpress.android.ui.media.MediaBrowserActivity.handleMultiSelectDelete(MediaBrowserActivity.java:765) at org.wordpress.android.ui.media.MediaBrowserActivity.onActionItemClicked(MediaBrowserActivity.java:729) at com.actionbarsherlock.internal.ActionBarSherlockNative$ActionModeCallbackWrapper.onActionItemClicked(ActionBarSherlockNative.java:257) at com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow$DecorView$ActionModeCallbackWrapper.onActionItemClicked(PhoneWindow.java:2755) at com.android.internal.app.ActionBarImpl$ActionModeImpl.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarImpl.java:969) at com.android.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.dispatchMenuItemSelected(MenuBuilder.java:735) at com.android.internal.view.menu.MenuItemImpl.invoke(MenuItemImpl.java:152) at com.android.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.performItemAction(MenuBuilder.java:874) at com.android.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuView.invokeItem(ActionMenuView.java:546) at com.android.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuItemView.onClick(ActionMenuItemView.java:115) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:4438)

buginformation.summary: Media stays empty after selecting invalid custom date
buginformation.description: Select "Custom Date" on the Media filter Choose two dates in the future so that no media appear Return to "Custom Date" and choose a date range that should show media No media appear, even though the date range is now valid

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Loading indicator never goes away
buginformation.description: Kind of crazy repro steps: Create a new WP.com account in the app. Create a new post on the brand new blog. You'll receive a 'Your first post on blog' notification. Open the notification. Observe the 'Loading' indicator beneath the notification never goes away.

buginformation.summary: Reader: Reblog option shown for self-hosted site
buginformation.description: In the Reader I was given the option to Reblog a post to a self-hosted site. I wasn't signed in the the WordPress.com account that this self-hosted site is using Jetpack with. Upon tapping the Reblog button, a toast message showed telling me it failed to Reblog.

buginformation.summary: Missing line break in specific notification
buginformation.description: The 'Record broken' stats notification has two sentences jumbled together at the end:

buginformation.summary: Empty string tag in the reader
buginformation.description: I just noticed I have an empty tag in the reader After debugging,

buginformation.summary: Refreshing comments list forgets the selected comment.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to comments. Tap a comment midway down the list to select it and view it in the detail screen. Refresh the comments list. When the refresh finishes the first comment in the list is selected.

buginformation.summary: NPE editing a post
buginformation.description: Problem is due to lack of null checking in Post.hasChanges(). java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.models.Post.hasChanges(Post.java:429) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity$3.onClick(EditPostActivity.java:338) at com.android.internal.app.AlertController$ButtonHandler.handleMessage(AlertController.java:166) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5017) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:779) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:595) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

buginformation.summary: Submitting post from media creates (Untitled) local draft
buginformation.description: I can repro this every time. Go to media, long press an image, then tap the pin icon to add it to a new post Give the post a title then submit it The "Uploading post" status notification shows for a second then disappears The post list now shows an (Untitled) local draft which is completely empty Refresh the post list, and the new post does show up but the (Untitled) one still remains

buginformation.summary: Comments list forgets checked items when resuming from background.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the comments list. Check one or more comments. Notice the moderation options appear. Send the app to the background. Resume the app. Nothing is checked but the moderation options are still visible.

buginformation.summary: Crash when loading a post with oodles and oodles of text.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This is probably too impractical to affect many, but documenting here. From a desktop browser, create a new post on your blog with lots and lots of text. I used the full text of Shakespeare's Hamlet from Project Gutenberg. Try to view the post in the app. Crash. So there is probably an upper limit of how much text can be displayed in the post view.

buginformation.summary: Load posts from wpDB method, clean up Post model
buginformation.description: I think one of the causes for #862 was that we are passing a localTableBlogId to the Posts model to load an existing post. There was no currentBlog, so the blogId was set to -1 and 'lost' in the database. We should simply pass a local post id to a method in wpDB that will retrieve the post. No need for the 'blogId' or 'isPage' parameters either. We could then remove the constructor in Posts.java that did database work.

buginformation.summary: Deleting post : confirmation appeared but post was still visible.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This was a little weird. I tried deleting a post by clicking the trashcan icon. I confirmed I wanted to delete the post. I saw the toast that the post was deleted. However the post was still visible on the screen until the post list refreshed. I think the right UX would be to show the toast after the post was removed.

buginformation.summary: Make sure to show the correct error message on login failure
buginformation.description: I was trying to add a self-hosted test blog that replied to getUsersBlogs with a malformed document and got a "There is no network available" error message :(
